field.description: Samples represent major outputs resulting from a protocol application. It should be either the first column containing sample names from the study file (if samples defined there), or should be preceeded by Source Name column otherwise.
an identifier to the Assay Node. It is used in Derived Data File as row identifier for the matrix of observations of the form 'Assay by Trait'

Name (or URI) of the file containing definitions of phenotypic traits measured in this assay. Each row of TDF contains a trait definition in the form: Measurement Type, Term Source REF, Term Accession Number, Technology Type, Term Source REF, Term Accession Number, Scale Name, Term Source REF, Term Accession Number. Trait names are used in Data Files in names of data columns.
Name (or URI) of the raw data file generated by an assay. No format restrictions.
an identifier for the data Transformation Node, describes the normalization procedure applied, if any. If there is nothing more to add (all was described in Protocol), leave empty.
an identifier for the data Transformation Node, describes the data transformation procedure applied, if any. If there is nothing more to add (all was described in Protocol), leave empty.

Name (or URI) of the derived data file generated from raw data by data processing. The file should be in the form of a 'Assay x Traits' matrix, where traits (i.e. columns) correspond to trait names (i.e. rows) from Trait Definition File. There is one column for each trait with continuous measurement (Trait value[<Trait Name>]) and three columns for each categorical trait (Trait value[<Trait Name>], Term Source Ref, Term Accession Number).
